climbs.name: Kellen Skeller Says Owiee!
climbs.fa: FA - Phil and Tally Reynolds,  Oct 2018

content.description: At east side of the perch.  Climb up on marginal rock moving on and off arete following natural line of rock on face holds.   Do not fall.
content.location: Get to the Ravens Perch  by scrambling up shallow gully about 40 feet to the west of the Represstional, using exposed rock and boulders as possible.  Slog up loose scree from  base of Ravens Perch to stable starting spot high on the east edge.

climbs.name: John Galt's Fault
climbs.fa: FA - Phil and Cabe Reynolds,  Oct 2018

content.description: Low angle slab climb starts with an odd, right leaning ramp before becoming friction face climbing above. Loose rock, manky gear placements, and marginal quality make this climb far more difficult than it looks. Avoid for any reason.
content.location: At the lowest point of exposed rock at base, find a weird broken ramp leading up and to the right. Tip toe up loose rock with no gear placements until ramp dissolves in about 30 feet then head straight up finding imaginary gear placements where ever you want.  Walk off to west.
